intro: Meum anethifolium, commonly known as field eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. Its leaves are finely divided, resembling those of anise, and it produces small white or yellowish flowers. Meum anethifolium is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
